(Studio) Lotta Nieminen<\/strong> is the award-winning creative practice of Lotta Nieminen, specializing in branding, art direction and graphic design for a wide range of global clients. With a multi-disciplinary approach, the studio brings concept-driven visual identities to life through thoughtfully crafted printed and digital implementations. Based between Paris and New York, (Studio) Lotta Nieminen works closely with a network of collaborators to tailor the right team for the needs of each project.<\/p>","rightfooter":[{"heading":"","text":"For inquiries and questions, please get in touch studio@lottanieminen.com<\/a>"}],"rightimage":[],"rightsrcset":"","righttype":null},"id":"5e439f85-fc27-42dc-9a7a-2df887966050","isHidden":false,"type":"folio"}]
strings.areas:
- image: - moda-26.jpg title: Brand Identities description: '

Overarching visual identity design from research and positioning to brand guidelines and implementation.

' extended: "" - image: - services-eadem.jpg title: Art Direction description: '

Visual concepts and on-set art direction for editorial photoshoots, e-com imagery, illustration and animation.

' extended: "" - image: - mde-25.jpg title: Print Design description: '

Packaging, printed brand collateral, editorial and book design, signage, print campaigns, print production.

' extended: "" - image: - services-digital.jpg title: Digital Design description: '

Website and e-commerce design, mobile design, social media design, newsletter design.

' extended: "" - image: - tray-01.jpg title: Product Design description: '

Concept and design for physical products and custom packaging.

' extended: "" - image: - services-illustration-02.jpg title: Illustration description: '

Illustration and pattern design for identities, packaging and campaigns. See full portfolio.

strings.bio:
PROFILE

Originally from Finland, Lotta Nieminen studied graphic design and illustration at the University of Art and Design Helsinki and the Rhode Island School of Design, before founding her namesake studio in 2012. She has recieved accolades such as Forbes magazine’s annual 30 Under 30, the Art Directors Club Young Guns award and Print magazine’s New Visual Artist, and given lectures and workshops at educational institutions and conferences across the United States and Europe. Her international client list includes Bvlgari, Hermes, New York Times, Liberty of London, Marimekko and Vanity Fair. Her approach across mediums is conceptual and holistic, guided by an interest for color, tactility and composition. She also works as an illustrator.

content: lefttoggle: true lefttext: "

Founded in 2014, Paintbox is a modern manicure studio in New York, reinventing the nail salon experience with an editorial but approachable point of view of seasonal nail art collections. The visual identity is built around a logo designed to work as a frame, hinting to the showcase aspect of nail art, while also doubling as a box, a nod to the name of the brand. The adaptive aspect of the logo was introduced to bring playfulness to an otherwise minimal identity: as the logo maintains the illusion of its square shape even when the words are distanced from one another, it leaves room for play across printed and digital implementations, fitting the logo to the surfaces it's applied on.

In 2018, the salon’s identity was expanded to embody the brand’s expansion into a product line of nail polishes: sold individually or as duos — the Power Couples — the packaging concept embodies the considered, playful approach to color theory that’s become a Paintbox trademark.

" leftfooter: - heading: Paintbox text: 2014—Present - heading: SERVICES text: 'Visual Identity

THE PACKAGING

The salon’s collection of 10–free nail polishes centres on the brand’s playful approach to color theory. Designed to bring the signature Paintbox experience home, Power Couples are seasonal duos of pre-matched, unexpected polish pairings. The packaging concept reflects this approach by pairing a sleeve in one color with a tray in the other, showing how the colors look side by side.

DIGITAL EXPERIENCE

The digital experience was reimagined for the launch of Paintbox’s product line, creating a seamless experience that allows to both book manicure appointments, as well as easily shop the brand’s expanding line of nail polishes. With the added emphasis on color, social media templates were redesigned with a playful approach to color: with each new polish, a new brand color is added to Paintbox’s expanding color palette. THE SPACE

Paintbox's physical location on the Upper East Side is the stage for an elevated, curated nail salon experience. The visual identity is implemented in a sophisticated, minimal way: printed items such as lookbooks, giftcards and custom napkins are designed to inspire and display the same attention to detail seen in the careful material choices of the salon itself. Interior Design: Fran Hickman; Interior Photography: Alice Gao

strings.title: Eadem
strings.introduction:
A SKINCARE BRAND FOR

the modern woman of color celebrates the multitudes within oneself.
strings.description: A skincare brand for the modern woman of color celebrates the multitudes within oneself.
strings.categories: Visual Identity, Art Direction, Web Design, Print Design
strings.features:
[{"content":{"lefttoggle":"false","lefttext":"","leftfooter":[],"leftimage":["eadem-01.jpg"],"leftsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/eadem\/ec2cfd0f29-1632848458\/eadem-01-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/eadem\/ec2cfd0f29-1632848458\/eadem-01-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/eadem\/ec2cfd0f29-1632848458\/eadem-01-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/eadem\/ec2cfd0f29-1632848458\/eadem-01-2048x.jpg 2048w","lefttype":"image","righttoggle":"false","righttext":"","rightfooter":[],"rightimage":["eadem-02.jpg"],"rightsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/eadem\/5815b1d5df-1632848458\/eadem-02-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/eadem\/5815b1d5df-1632848458\/eadem-02-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/eadem\/5815b1d5df-1632848458\/eadem-02-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/eadem\/5815b1d5df-1632848458\/eadem-02-2048x.jpg 2048w","righttype":"image"},"id":"b1c79938-c96e-4547-8ed0-4edcfb683dd5","isHidden":false,"type":"folio"},{"content":{"lefttoggle":"true","lefttext":"

Eadem is a beauty and lifestyle brand for the modern woman of color, pushing against preconceived cultural stereotypes. The brand exists for a wide spectrum of people across cultures, ethnicities, and skin colors: these multitudes are reflected through every detail of the identity and its implementations. Pronounced ee\u00b7\u200bdem, Eadem means the same or all in Latin, alluding to the invisible bonds and stories that bind women of color together, defining their daily existence.<\/p>

The visual identity celebrates the many facets of the Eadem woman: simultaneously strong and soft, holding her own unique self without loosing sight of her heritage. This duality is embodied in a logo that seems angular on first glance, but contains soft shapes upon closer examination. The handdrawn logo has a distinct personality that emphasizes the idea that these are products designed specifically for you. A large, unapologetic logo taking over each surface it's on evokes confidence in oneself \u2014 one Eadem strives to help their customers find. The multiplicity is equally embodied in typography \u2014 a mix of serif and sans serif, balancing playfulness and sophistication \u2014 and an energetic, bold color palette. Since launching, the brand has been quickly recognized by publications from Vogue to The Cut.<\/p>","leftfooter":[{"heading":"Eadem","text":"2021"},{"heading":"SERVICES","text":"Visual Identity
Packaging Design

THE LOGOTYPE<\/p>

The multifaceted Eadem woman is embodied in a logo that seems angular on first glance, but contains soft shapes upon closer examination. A hand-drawn sans serif, its curved crossbars take their shape from the bowl of the letter D. Details of the logotype are optically tweaked for visually equal weight throughout. The monogram is an abbreviated version of the full logotype, using only the letter E. It can be used as an alternative to the logo, and works well for inlays by inserting a photograph or video inside of it. The inlay monogram can be used on its own or juxtaposed on another photograph, further enhancing the idea of juxtaposition: heritage and one\u2019s unique self co-existing within a person.<\/p>","rightfooter":[],"rightimage":[],"rightsrcset":"","righttype":null},"id":"b8b15814-25f7-4e5e-a16c-2c2f94f83ff8","isHidden":false,"type":"folio"},{"content":{"lefttoggle":"false","lefttext":"","leftfooter":[],"leftimage":["eadem-12.jpg"],"leftsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/eadem\/a8b5fab0f7-1632848458\/eadem-12-352x.jpg TYPOGRAPHY<\/p>

The use of type throughout the Eadem identity is playful but sophisticated, mixing serif and sans serif in titles to reinforce the idea of duality present throughout visual identity concept. The type palette consists of Mabry \u2014 a forthright sans serif by type foundry Colophon, used for titles in all caps or captions in lowercase \u2014 and ITC Galliard \u2014 based on a 16th century typeface, used for titles and longer body copy \u2014 to form an elevated balance across centuries.<\/p>","leftfooter":[],"leftimage":[],"leftsrcset":"","lefttype":null,"righttoggle":"false","righttext":"","rightfooter":[],"rightimage":["eadem-19.jpg"],"rightsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/eadem\/52b7ed7d92-1632848458\/eadem-19-352x.jpg DIGITAL EXPERIENCE<\/p>

strings.title: Moda Operandi
strings.introduction:
A NEW VISUAL IDENTITY

for fashion destination Moda Operandi opens windows into a world of style.
strings.description: A new visual identity for fashion destination Moda Operandi opens windows into a world of style.
strings.features:
[{"content":{"lefttoggle":"false","lefttext":"","leftfooter":[],"leftimage":["moda-01.jpg"],"leftsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/moda-operandi\/b5fbabdf48-1632767747\/moda-01-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/moda-operandi\/b5fbabdf48-1632767747\/moda-01-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/moda-operandi\/b5fbabdf48-1632767747\/moda-01-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/moda-operandi\/b5fbabdf48-1632767747\/moda-01-2048x.jpg 2048w","lefttype":"image","righttoggle":"false","righttext":"","rightfooter":[],"rightimage":["moda-02.jpg"],"rightsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/moda-operandi\/4f9bad5589-1632767747\/moda-02-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/moda-operandi\/4f9bad5589-1632767747\/moda-02-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/moda-operandi\/4f9bad5589-1632767747\/moda-02-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/moda-operandi\/4f9bad5589-1632767747\/moda-02-2048x.jpg 2048w","righttype":"image"},"id":"5fc5798c-6555-47bb-b78e-10b9f4c31b22","isHidden":false,"type":"folio"},{"content":{"lefttoggle":"true","lefttext":"

Founded in 2010, Moda Operandi is an online luxury fashion retailer: a shopping destination for high-fashion and a platform for fashion discovery.<\/p>

The new visual identity transforms this concept of discovery into an abstracted window through which to explore the world of Moda Operandi: a portal into extraordinary worlds awaiting to be discovered. The result is a library of shapes that are expressive, yet create cohesiveness in a universe of varied photographic styles. Personality and adaptiveness were set as the foundations of an ownable identity that stands apart: custom created typefaces amplify an original visual voice and position the identity for a modern audience, while a bold take on color balances character and sophistication to create visual variation throughout brand touchpoints.<\/p>","leftfooter":[{"heading":"Moda Operandi","text":"2019"},{"heading":"SERVICES","text":"Visual Identity

THE WINDOWS<\/p>

The shapes form a key component of the Moda Operandi visual identity. Designed as portals into a world of fashion, they can be used as windows into photography, or on their own as color surfaces. They can perform different actions throughout printed and digital implementations: emphasize, reveal or create cohesiveness to diverse vendor and runway imagery. In addition to two signature shapes \u2014 an oval and a bow-tie hexagon \u2014 a variety of additional windows can be created by combining circles, rectangles and triangles. Video: Emma CUSTOM TYPOGRAPHY<\/p>

Two custom created display typefaces underline the uniqueness of Moda Operandi: brought to life by type foundry Schick Toikka, Moda Sans and Moda Serif embody the same bold and sophisticated qualities as the overall visual identity. They are a matching pair \u2014 two typefaces that share the same proportions but with different personalities. Their detailing is unexpected for members of the same type family: Moda Serif has a refined, sophisticated look with painterly flourishes and details, whereas Moda Sans is utilitarian, matter-of-fact and strong with playful detailing. They are designed to work both separately and together, and give the brand personality, depth and contrast. The brand typefaces are also used to create the new Moda Operandi wordmark, with the spacing and weight of the original fonts adjusted to work across digital and printed environments in various sizes. Custom type design: Schick Toikka<\/a><\/p>","leftfooter":[],"leftimage":[],"leftsrcset":"","lefttype":null,"righttoggle":"false","righttext":"","rightfooter":[],"rightimage":["moda-17-lo.mp4"],"rightsrcset":"","righttype":"video"},"id":"f5e941fb-c9eb-40ff-b4d1-68feb422f868","isHidden":false,"type":"folio"},{"content":{"image":["moda-21.jpg"],"srcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/moda-operandi\/412cc0fe9c-1632846591\/moda-21-352x.jpg THE COLORS<\/p>

Reflective of a playful approach to fashion and dressing up, the Moda Operandi color palette is bold and confident, without loosing sophistication. The vibrant and playful palette makes Moda Operandi stand apart in a space where more restrained palettes are typically used. The color palette comes to life especially in printed implementations, while the usage is more considered in digital implementations, where photography takes center strings.title: Maison d'Etto
strings.introduction:
ARCHITECTURE AND

nature meet in the visual identity for fragrance house Maison d’Etto.
strings.description: Architecture and nature meet in the visual identity for fragrance house Maison d’Etto.
strings.categories: Visual Identity, Art Direction, Web Design, Print Design
strings.features:
[{"content":{"lefttoggle":"false","lefttext":"","leftfooter":[],"leftimage":["mde-01.jpg"],"leftsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/maison-d-etto\/9f1186e277-1632848458\/mde-01-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/maison-d-etto\/9f1186e277-1632848458\/mde-01-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/maison-d-etto\/9f1186e277-1632848458\/mde-01-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/maison-d-etto\/9f1186e277-1632848458\/mde-01-2048x.jpg 2048w","lefttype":"image","righttoggle":"false","righttext":"","rightfooter":[],"rightimage":["mde-02.jpg"],"rightsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/maison-d-etto\/a06d549b87-1632848458\/mde-02-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/maison-d-etto\/a06d549b87-1632848458\/mde-02-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/maison-d-etto\/a06d549b87-1632848458\/mde-02-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/maison-d-etto\/a06d549b87-1632848458\/mde-02-2048x.jpg 2048w","righttype":"image"},"id":"7fce601b-df06-4e75-a649-219ca343f00e","isHidden":false,"type":"folio"},{"content":{"lefttoggle":"true","lefttext":"

A luxury brand of artisanal fragrances drawing inspiration from the world or art and architecture, the Maison d\u2019Etto story is also deeply rooted the contemporary equestrian lifestyle. A stable in Argentina \u2014 where architecture and nature seamlessly meet \u2014 served as inspiration for the identity: patterns reminiscent of its constructions help create a sense of place in both printed and digital implementations.<\/p>

The graphic shapes are paired with a moss green that alludes to nature and softens the harder geometry of the patterns. In line with the gender-neutral approach of the scents, the visual identity balances the feminine and masculine, with the sum of its parts never being clearly one or the other. The identity is positioned for a modern market, while being conscious of the past: elegant but never dull, the design elements play with mixing the classic and the avant-garde. The logotype and its abbreviated monogram version use exaggerated spacing between elements to break the familiarity of a more traditional type treatment. A detail-focused approach to design is key in creating a luxurious brand throughout all touch points: the quality of the product is highlighted with a considered use of high-end materials, printing methods, and digital executions.<\/p>","leftfooter":[{"heading":"Maison d\u2019Etto","text":"2019"},{"heading":"SERVICES","text":"Visual Identity

https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/maison-d-etto\/52007f30a5-1632848458\/mde-10-2048x.jpg 2048w","righttype":"image"},"id":"bee21645-aee5-4f69-9cd8-9bea7702771c","isHidden":false,"type":"folio"},{"content":{"lefttoggle":"false","lefttext":"

THE PATTERNS<\/p>

The Maison d\u2019Etto patterns used throughout the visual identity are derived and abstracted from architectural reference images. A stable in Argentina, where architecture and nature seamlessly meet, served as inspiration for the hero pattern used in the fragrance packaging patterns reminiscent of its constructions help create a sense of place in both printed and digital implementations. All patterns follow the rule of using rectangular pieces only to remain versatile but cohesive, the shapes can never be organic. They can be used as overlays over photography, or in printed implementations as a blind emboss for added tactility.<\/p>","leftfooter":[],"leftimage":["mde-11.jpg"],"leftsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/maison-d-etto\/544bfe3cd3-1632848458\/mde-11-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/maison-d-etto\/544bfe3cd3-1632848458\/mde-11-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/maison-d-etto\/544bfe3cd3-1632848458\/mde-11-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/maison-d-etto\/544bfe3cd3-1632848458\/mde-11-2048x.jpg 2048w","lefttype":"image","righttoggle":"true","righttext":"

THE PATTERNS<\/p>

Elevated and playful in equal measure, the patterns form a key component of the Maison d\u2019Etto visual identity. They are derived from reference images across architecture and art, and consist of geometric shapes that are used to create a feel of space or motion. They are used in printed implementations as a blind emboss for added tactility, or as overlays over photography \u2014 used either horizontally or vertically, the pattern should take over the entire surface it\u2019s applied upon.<\/p>","rightfooter":[],"rightimage":["mde-11.jpg"],"rightsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/maison-d-etto\/544bfe3cd3-1632848458\/mde-11-352x.jpg 352w, PACKAGING<\/p>

The Maison d\u2019Etto packaging is experiential and high-quality. Designed as a keepsake, the high-end packaging is sturdy, made from Japanese paper mill Takeo\u2019s environmentally-friendly Biotope paper stock. A highly tactile, matte paper stock in deep, rich moss is blind embossed with a Maison d\u2019Etto pattern and hot stamped in white with the logo and other copy. Like the identity, the cap of the fragrance bottle draws its inspiration from the worlds of art and architecture \u2014 resembling a sculpture, the dome-like cap appears to float over the circular bottle. The geometric pattern is repeated on the ribbed texture of the label.<\/p>","leftfooter":[],"leftimage":["mde-15.jpg"],"leftsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/maison-d-etto\/539390f764-1632848458\/mde-15-352x.jpg 352w, DIGITAL EXPERIENCE<\/p>

The Maison d\u2019Etto website is designed to be both aspirational and utilitarian: strong editorial imagery tells a story, while clear product detail pages provide thorough olfactory information to a consumer making a purchase decision without possibly having smelled the perfume in person. View website<\/a><\/p>","rightfooter":[],"rightimage":[],"rightsrcset":"","righttype":null},"id":"f6bf9598-78e5-4e05-aaff-51519c101b99","isHidden":false,"type":"folio"},{"content":{"image":["mde-27.jpg"],"srcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/maison-d-etto\/74d8e09561-1632849260\/mde-27-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/maison-d-etto\/74d8e09561-1632849260\/mde-27-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/maison-d-etto\/74d8e09561-1632849260\/mde-27-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/maison-d-etto\/74d8e09561-1632849260\/mde-27-2048x.jpg 2048w","type":"image"},"id":"5ccec654-e35c-4e0d-a452-91a8494379e8","isHidden":false,"type":"landscape"},{"content":{"image":["mde-28.jpg"],"srcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/maison-d-etto\/89f35e2edf-1632848458\/mde-28-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/maison-d-etto\/89f35e2edf-1632848458\/mde-28-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/maison-d-etto\/89f35e2edf-1632848458\/mde-28-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/maison-d-etto\/89f35e2edf-1632848458\/mde-28-2048x.jpg 2048w","type":"image"},"id":"ccd58fca-0561-404f-ab56-d7e9ba44f26a","isHidden":false,"type":"landscape"},{"content":{"lefttoggle":"true","lefttext":"

LIMITED EDITION SCARF<\/p>

For the brand\u2019s first implementation onto textile, the pattern is more intricate, taking over a larger surface to form an abstracted facade. Working in two inverted colorways, the pattern is created to be versatile, changing in look as it is worn, like a building looked at from a different angle, in a different light. The deep moss green, also used throughout the rest of the identity, alludes to a connection to nature and softens the harder geometry of the patterns.<\/p>","leftfooter":[],"leftimage":[],"leftsrcset":"","lefttype":null,"righttoggle":"false","righttext":"","rightfooter":[],"rightimage":["mde-38.jpg"],"rightsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/maison-d-etto\/7784d519b8-1632848458\/mde-38-352x.jpg strings.title: Steen & Strøm
strings.introduction:
A NEW CHAPTER FOR

the Oslo department store, interpreting its long history through a modern lens.
strings.description: A new chapter for the Oslo department store, interpreting its history through a modern lens.
strings.features:
[{"content":{"lefttoggle":"false","lefttext":"","leftfooter":[],"leftimage":["steenstrom-01.jpg"],"leftsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/steen-strom\/373a33fa02-1632849260\/steenstrom-01-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/steen-strom\/373a33fa02-1632849260\/steenstrom-01-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/steen-strom\/373a33fa02-1632849260\/steenstrom-01-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/steen-strom\/373a33fa02-1632849260\/steenstrom-01-2048x.jpg 2048w","lefttype":"image","righttoggle":"false","righttext":"","rightfooter":[],"rightimage":["steenstrom-02-c.jpg"],"rightsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/steen-strom\/05ab835389-1632849260\/steenstrom-02-c-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/steen-strom\/05ab835389-1632849260\/steenstrom-02-c-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/steen-strom\/05ab835389-1632849260\/steenstrom-02-c-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/steen-strom\/05ab835389-1632849260\/steenstrom-02-c-2048x.jpg 2048w","righttype":"image"},"id":"fbeae8ec-9325-4cb6-af4d-c49e38b8c1af","isHidden":false,"type":"folio"},{"content":{"lefttoggle":"true","lefttext":"

Steen & Str\u00f8m is a renowned luxury department store and Oslo landmark, bringing together exclusive high-end brands and quality service since opening its doors in 1797. The reimagined visual identity is bold but elevated, balancing tradition and the forward-thinking attitude that has defined the department store's history. Inspired by Steen & Str\u00f8m's iconic building, it honors the past by reinterpreting architectural details that become building blocks of a new contemporary identity.<\/p>

At the center of the identity is the cornerstone shape \u2014 a graphic reinterpretation of the double S monogram that takes its form from the corner of the department store\u2019s building. The founding year is added to the name to reference the brand\u2019s long heritage while keeping an eye to the future. Together with a modern type and color palette, the brand elements give Steen & Str\u00f8m a renewed confidence and a visual voice that repositions them for a new chapter at the forefront of Norwegian retail.<\/p>","leftfooter":[{"heading":"Steen & Strom","text":"2021"},{"heading":"SERVICES","text":"Visual Identity

THE CORNERSTONE SHAPE<\/p>

At the center of the new Steen & Str\u00f8m identity is a graphic reinterpretation of the double S monogram that takes its form from the circular corner of the building. It can be used overlaid with imagery, on its own, in window displays, or paired with the logotype. Additional shape elements are inspired by other details found in the building's history, such as striped awnings and window displays, and are used to bring variety and flexibility to the new identity's visual A NEW NAME<\/p>

The Steen & Str\u00f8m wordmark is an outlined logotype created from a roman capital with classic proportions \u2014 while the spacing, weight and details of the original typeface have been manually adjusted to reflect details found in older iterations of the Steen & Str\u00f8m logotype, an exaggerated spacing and unexpected setup gives the logo a modern spin. The addition of the founding year \u2013 1797 \u2013 shines the spotlight on the lengthy history of the Oslo landmark.<\/p>","rightfooter":[],"rightimage":[],"rightsrcset":"","righttype":null},"id":"3210bee5-dada-4e53-8919-7a70e0fd934b","isHidden":false,"type":"folio"},{"content":{"lefttoggle":"false","lefttext":"","leftfooter":[],"leftimage":["steenstrom-20.jpg"],"leftsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/steen-strom\/ccb204178b-1632849260\/steenstrom-20-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/steen-strom\/ccb204178b-1632849260\/steenstrom-20-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/steen-strom\/ccb204178b-1632849260\/steenstrom-20-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/steen-strom\/ccb204178b-1632849260\/steenstrom-20-2048x.jpg 2048w","lefttype":"image","righttoggle":"false","righttext":"","rightfooter":[],"rightimage":["steenstrom-21.jpg"],"rightsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/steen-strom\/af477737d0-1632849260\/steenstrom-21-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/steen-strom\/af477737d0-1632849260\/steenstrom-21-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/steen-strom\/af477737d0-1632849260\/steenstrom-21-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/steen-strom\/af477737d0-1632849260\/steenstrom-21-2048x.jpg 2048w","righttype":"image"},"id":"0ad6ae59-298e-4c77-93b1-ff0cd1c9b56b","isHidden":false,"type":"folio"},{"content":{"lefttoggle":"true","lefttext":"

strings.title: Paloroma
strings.introduction:
A FRIENDLY IDENTITY SUITE

for Paloroma, a bathcare line with little ones in mind.
strings.description: A friendly identity suite for Paloroma, a bathcare line with little ones in mind.
strings.categories: Visual Identity, Print Design, Web Design
strings.features:
[{"content":{"lefttoggle":"false","lefttext":"","leftfooter":[],"leftimage":["palo-01.jpg"],"leftsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/paloroma\/0ce1b82de6-1632861685\/palo-01-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/paloroma\/0ce1b82de6-1632861685\/palo-01-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/paloroma\/0ce1b82de6-1632861685\/palo-01-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/paloroma\/0ce1b82de6-1632861685\/palo-01-2048x.jpg 2048w","lefttype":"image","righttoggle":"false","righttext":"","rightfooter":[],"rightimage":["palo-02.jpg"],"rightsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/paloroma\/4f1604dcca-1632861685\/palo-02-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/paloroma\/4f1604dcca-1632861685\/palo-02-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/paloroma\/4f1604dcca-1632861685\/palo-02-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/paloroma\/4f1604dcca-1632861685\/palo-02-2048x.jpg 2048w","righttype":"image"},"id":"a820463c-c186-4833-9d5b-c5aeae25f27c","isHidden":false,"type":"folio"},{"content":{"lefttoggle":"true","lefttext":"

Paloroma is a modern baby and child brand that offers a variety of curated skincare products: pure and high quality ingredients, never dumbed-down in their design. Named after their children \u2014 Paloma and Roman \u2014 the brand was born out of the founders' quest to find products for children that they could trust and relate to. Void of harsh chemicals or fragrances, the products are clean and fragrance-free.<\/p>

Built around the concept of friendship, the visual identity is centred around bringing Paloma and Roman front and center as characters seen on little adventures across brand implementations, along with their new friend Bird. The use of illustrated characters helps not only personify the brand, but also brings warmth and playfulness to an otherwise elevated aesthetic through hand-drawn elements sprinkled throughout implementations. A chic use of color and whimsical type palette modernize a playful identity drawing inspiration from the past.<\/p>","leftfooter":[{"heading":"Paloroma","text":"2019"},{"heading":"SERVICES","text":"Visual Identity

THE BIRD<\/p>

The Paloroma logo consists of two elements: the logotype and the logomark. A stylized, outlined version of the character from the illustration palette, the logomark is an oval shape containing Bird, with a wing in the shape of the letter \u2018P\u2019 for Paloroma. The logotype and logomark can be used both together or separately.<\/p>","rightfooter":[],"rightimage":[],"rightsrcset":"","righttype":null},"id":"ae72050f-60c5-4254-b31b-c15b0a5fb308","isHidden":false,"type":"folio"},{"content":{"lefttoggle":"false","lefttext":"","leftfooter":[],"leftimage":["palo-15.jpg"],"leftsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/paloroma\/2a7cc67b33-1632861685\/palo-15-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/paloroma\/2a7cc67b33-1632861685\/palo-15-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/paloroma\/2a7cc67b33-1632861685\/palo-15-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/paloroma\/2a7cc67b33-1632861685\/palo-15-2048x.jpg 2048w","lefttype":"image","righttoggle":"false","righttext":"","rightfooter":[],"rightimage":["palo-26.jpg"],"rightsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/paloroma\/6f747e40d8-1632861685\/palo-26-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/paloroma\/6f747e40d8-1632861685\/palo-26-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/paloroma\/6f747e40d8-1632861685\/palo-26-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/paloroma\/6f747e40d8-1632861685\/palo-26-2048x.jpg 2048w","righttype":"image"},"id":"476d0f29-e722-49a9-aa7f-3dbf57cd090d","isHidden":false,"type":"folio"},{"content":{"lefttoggle":"true","lefttext":"

THE ILLUSTRATIONS<\/p>

The Paloroma identity\u2019s hero are its illustrated characters \u2014 Paloma, Roman and Bird \u2014 appearing in little adventures across printed and digital touchpoints. The use of illustrated characters helps not only personify the brand, but also brings warmth and playfulness to an otherwise elevated aesthetic through hand-drawn elements sprinkled throughout implementations. The illustrations are also used to create a pattern, that can be used in implementations such as gift package, canvas pouches or tissue paper, while animated vignettes bring the characters to life in digital implementations. Animation: Mercy strings.title: Paintbox
strings.introduction:
EXPANDING THE NAIL

salon's visual identity into a color-driven product line of playful packaging.
strings.description: Expanding the nail salon’s visual identity into a color-driven product line of playful packaging.
strings.categories: Visual Identity, Print Design, Web Design, Art Direction
strings.features:
[{"content":{"lefttoggle":"false","lefttext":"","leftfooter":[],"leftimage":["pb-01.jpg"],"leftsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/paintbox\/4026ccbe3c-1632851725\/pb-01-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/paintbox\/4026ccbe3c-1632851725\/pb-01-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/paintbox\/4026ccbe3c-1632851725\/pb-01-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/paintbox\/4026ccbe3c-1632851725\/pb-01-2048x.jpg 2048w","lefttype":"image","righttoggle":"false","righttext":"","rightfooter":[],"rightimage":["pb-02.jpg"],"rightsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/paintbox\/596965fbb0-1632851725\/pb-02-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/paintbox\/596965fbb0-1632851725\/pb-02-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/paintbox\/596965fbb0-1632851725\/pb-02-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/paintbox\/596965fbb0-1632851725\/pb-02-2048x.jpg 2048w","righttype":"image"},"id":"43f5a8f2-5cb9-49c8-ac67-25a61283f8ac","isHidden":false,"type":"folio"},{"content":{"lefttoggle":"true","lefttext":"

Founded in 2014, Paintbox is a modern manicure studio in New York, reinventing the nail salon experience with a curated but approachable point of view of seasonal nail art collections. The visual identity is built around a logo designed to work as a frame, hinting to the showcase aspect of nail art, while also doubling as a box, a nod to the name of the brand. The adaptive aspect of the logo was introduced to bring playfulness to an otherwise minimal identity: as the logo maintains the illusion of its square shape even when the words are distanced from one another, it leaves room for play across printed and digital implementations, fitting the logo to the surfaces it's applied on.<\/p>

In 2018, the salon\u2019s identity was expanded to embody the brand\u2019s expansion into a product line of nail polishes: sold individually or as duos \u2014 the Power Couples \u2014 the packaging concept embodies the considered, playful approach to color theory that\u2019s become a Paintbox trademark.<\/p>","leftfooter":[{"heading":"Paintbox","text":"2014\u2014Present"},{"heading":"SERVICES","text":"Visual Identity
Packaging Design
Web Design
Art Direction

Photography \/ Hands: Aileen THE PACKAGING<\/p>

The salon\u2019s collection of 10\u2013free nail polishes centres on the brand\u2019s playful approach to color theory. Designed to bring the signature Paintbox experience home, Power Couples are seasonal duos of pre-matched, unexpected polish pairings. The packaging concept reflects this approach by pairing a sleeve in one color with a tray in the other, showing how the colors look side by DIGITAL EXPERIENCE<\/p>

The digital experience was reimagined for the launch of Paintbox\u2019s product line, creating a seamless experience that allows to both book manicure appointments, as well as easily shop the brand\u2019s expanding line of nail polishes. With the added emphasis on color, social media templates were redesigned with a playful approach to color: with each new polish, a new brand color is added to Paintbox\u2019s expanding color palette. THE SPACE<\/p>

Paintbox's physical location on the Upper East Side is the stage for an elevated nail salon experience. Matter Made is an American manufacturer of contemporary lighting, furniture, and objects. The eponymous in-house collection of New York design destination Matter, the brand collaborates with some of the most influential and innovative designers working today.<\/p>

To embody Matter\u2019s modern and elevated approach, the visual identity centers around a robust monogram that breaks the symmetry of the two M\u2019s. A limited palette of dark, earthy hues ties printed implementations together, and is elevated with the use of gold and black foil to reflect the Matter\u2019s high-end product line. The brand\u2019s commitment to the highest level of refinement and finish in their pieces is reflected in equal attention to detail throughout brand implementations.<\/p>","leftfooter":[{"heading":"Matter Made","text":"2015\u20142019"},{"heading":"SERVICES","text":"Visual Identity

THE MONOGRAM<\/p>

The Matter Made logotype breaks the symmetry of the M initials and can be abbreviated into a monogram, expanding on an original visual concept by Benjamin Critton. The monogram takes over the width or height of the surface it\u2019s on, while the full logo is used in smaller scale. From 2017 onwards, the M.M monogram was used to create an annual version by spelling the corresponding year in roman numerals for collection specific implementations such as printed catalogs, tote bags and E-COMMERCE<\/p>

The e-commerce experience was designed to lend itself to both Matter \u2014 the furniture gallery and showroom \u2014 and Matter Made \u2014 the in-house furniture brand. Using the same core structure and type palette, the two versions were varied by implementing the signature brand colors for Matter Made, and a more robust navigation and designer index for Matter. CATALOG 2018 (M.M XVIII)<\/p>

As the previous editions, the 2018 catalog builds on Matter Made's core identity elements. The product list is printed on the outer cover, covered by a large silkscreened monogram that is translucent enough to retain legibility where elements overlap. The grey double cover folds out into a designer inde to reveal an open cloth spine. The interior pages use a mix of high gloss paper for the photography section, and uncoated stock for product strings.title: Jennifer Behr
strings.introduction:
AN ADAPTIVE LOGO

centers on the transformative nature of jewelry and headpieces.
strings.description: An adaptive logo centers on the transformative nature of jewelry and headpieces.
strings.features:
[{"content":{"lefttoggle":"false","lefttext":"","leftfooter":[],"leftimage":["jb-01-b.jpg"],"leftsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/jennifer-behr\/ab3ef8eba1-1632851725\/jb-01-b-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/jennifer-behr\/ab3ef8eba1-1632851725\/jb-01-b-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/jennifer-behr\/ab3ef8eba1-1632851725\/jb-01-b-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/jennifer-behr\/ab3ef8eba1-1632851725\/jb-01-b-2048x.jpg 2048w","lefttype":"image","righttoggle":"false","righttext":"","rightfooter":[],"rightimage":["jb-02.jpg"],"rightsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/jennifer-behr\/041472b43f-1632851725\/jb-02-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/jennifer-behr\/041472b43f-1632851725\/jb-02-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/jennifer-behr\/041472b43f-1632851725\/jb-02-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/jennifer-behr\/041472b43f-1632851725\/jb-02-2048x.jpg 2048w","righttype":"image"},"id":"db0e4675-79e9-4d51-8907-2cdca1123e49","isHidden":false,"type":"folio"},{"content":{"lefttoggle":"true","lefttext":"

Jennifer Behr is one of fashion\u2019s pioneering luxury hair accessory brands \u2014 a namesake brand of distinctive, high-end hair accessories, headpieces and jewelry, made by hand from start to finish in New York City. The luxury of the product is reflected in an identity that feels elevated across both printed and digital brand touchpoints. Balancing the soft and the strong, the branding defines modern femininity through sophisticated strength. The identity is recognizable, but flexible enough to act as a versatile backdrop for the variety of pieces in the current and upcoming collections.<\/p>

In the redesigned visual identity, the jewelry is abstracted and embedded into the logo: tiny jewels are positioned above or inside the logotype to create an adaptive system where interchangeable symbols and lockups emphasize the transformational relationship to wearing jewelry and headpieces. The result is a highly flexible toolkit of different logos designed to work in a playful and elevated way across implementations.<\/p>","leftfooter":[{"heading":"Jennifer Behr","text":"2020"},{"heading":"SERVICES","text":"Visual Identity
Web Design

CREDITS
Photography \/ Model: M.K. Sadler
Photography \/ Product: Anthony Verde
Animation: Lars H\u00f6gstr\u00f6m
Ecommerce Development: strings.title: Exhibition Works Etc
strings.introduction:
EXHIBITION DESIGN

for solo show at Design Museum Helsinki.
strings.description: Exhibition design for solo show at Design Museum Helsinki.
strings.features:
[{"content":{"lefttoggle":"false","lefttext":"","leftfooter":[],"leftimage":["lnworks-01.jpg"],"leftsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/exhibition-works-etc\/b27ecaa6e4-1632688823\/lnworks-01-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/exhibition-works-etc\/b27ecaa6e4-1632688823\/lnworks-01-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/exhibition-works-etc\/b27ecaa6e4-1632688823\/lnworks-01-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/exhibition-works-etc\/b27ecaa6e4-1632688823\/lnworks-01-2048x.jpg 2048w","lefttype":"image","righttoggle":"false","righttext":"","rightfooter":[],"rightimage":["lnworks-02.jpg"],"rightsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/exhibition-works-etc\/a3e57cfce9-1632688823\/lnworks-02-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/exhibition-works-etc\/a3e57cfce9-1632688823\/lnworks-02-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/exhibition-works-etc\/a3e57cfce9-1632688823\/lnworks-02-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/exhibition-works-etc\/a3e57cfce9-1632688823\/lnworks-02-2048x.jpg 2048w","righttype":"image"},"id":"c3143916-444d-4751-9a56-79eee1be36e6","isHidden":false,"type":"folio"},{"content":{"lefttoggle":"true","lefttext":"

Works, Etc. \/ T\u00f6it\u00e4, jne is a solo show of Lotta Nieminen\u2019s work. Displayed at the Design Museum Helsinki in March 2019, the exhibition was adjoined with the Graphic Designer of The Year 2019 award, an annual recognition by Grafia (Association of Visual Communication Designers Finland).<\/p>

\u201cThis exhibition explores the same elements as my graphic design and illustration work \u2014 color, shape, white space and their relationship \u2014 in order to create a larger world around a selection of existing work. Rather than just a display for the graphic design pieces, the \u201cetc.\u201d reexamines the work by removing them from their original utilitarian functions: staging them in new contexts or exploring their themes through new mediums and scales. Taking the forms of a metal frame or large colored boxes arranged into stacks, these new extensions are not quite graphic design, not quite art, not quite furniture.\u201d<\/p>","leftfooter":[{"heading":"Solo Exhibition","text":"2019"},{"heading":"SERVICES","text":"Exhibition Design

CREDITS
Photography \/ Edition I: Jonne Sippola
Photography \/ Edition II: Lotta EDITION II<\/p>

For its second instalment, Works etc. was recreated for Helsinki Design Week 2019, taking over a neo-renaissance palace from 1891 in central Helsinki. Designed to be remixed, the building blocks of the original edition were reassembled in a new space to offer a new point of view to the work. The pre-existing colors of the space itself stage the building blocks in a new way, creating an alternative experience to the original all-white strings.title: Cienne
strings.introduction:
A VIBRANT IDENTITY

for sustainable womenswear brand, inspired by the colors of its collections.
strings.description: A vibrant identity for sustainable womenswear brand, inspired by the colors of its collections.
strings.categories: Visual Identity, Print Design, Web Design
strings.features:
[{"content":{"lefttoggle":"false","lefttext":"","leftfooter":[],"leftimage":["cn-01.jpg"],"leftsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/cienne\/c064eb732d-1632851725\/cn-01-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/cienne\/c064eb732d-1632851725\/cn-01-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/cienne\/c064eb732d-1632851725\/cn-01-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/cienne\/c064eb732d-1632851725\/cn-01-2048x.jpg 2048w","lefttype":"image","righttoggle":"false","righttext":"","rightfooter":[],"rightimage":["cn-02.jpg"],"rightsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/cienne\/fb8a257748-1632851725\/cn-02-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/cienne\/fb8a257748-1632851725\/cn-02-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/cienne\/fb8a257748-1632851725\/cn-02-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/cienne\/fb8a257748-1632851725\/cn-02-2048x.jpg 2048w","righttype":"image"},"id":"d7a0ab2d-e0e8-4558-bcc8-7f7744565206","isHidden":false,"type":"folio"},{"content":{"lefttoggle":"true","lefttext":"

Cienne is a New York-based womenswear label with an eco-friendly ethos. The ready-to-wear brand is socially and environmentally conscious, with an elevated aesthetic. The high quality materials are sourced from artisans around the world and produced in high-end factories in New York. The result is tightly edited collections that work as versatile building blocks for a minimalist wardrobe.<\/p>

A Cienne woman is strong and fun, sophisticated but adventurous. To embody these qualities, the identity builds around a vibrant, bold color palette, pulled from the fabrics and patterns used in the very first collection. As the brand\u2019s versatile silhouettes, the brand colors are designed to be layered or stand alone. The colors are balanced with a simple, effective logotype and a clean but playful typographic palette \u2014 the result is bold, modern simplicity, reflective of Cienne\u2019s collections.<\/p>","leftfooter":[{"heading":"Cienne","text":"2014\u20142018"},{"heading":"SERVICES","text":"Visual Identity
Packaging Design
Editorial Design
Web Design

CREDITS
Photography \/ Model: Sarah Blais
E-commerce Development: Hugo & IN PRINT<\/p>

In print, the emphasis is on color. Pulled from the fabrics used in the brand's first collection, the bright red and magenta are a powerful pair that shines side by side in packaging. They\u2019re complemented by pops of green, black and cream across the packaging suite. The printed materials are produced with attention to detail and designed as THE WEBSITE<\/p>

While the red and magenta form the key colors of printed implementations, the website relies heavily on black to give center stage to the product and brand photography. Built on a fully customized Shopify platform, the website pairs an informative e-commerce experience with engaging storytelling about the thinking behind the brand.<\/p>","leftfooter":[],"leftimage":[],"leftsrcset":"","lefttype":null,"righttoggle":"false","righttext":"","rightfooter":[],"rightimage":["cn-17.jpg"],"rightsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/cienne\/dc007c14c8-1632851725\/cn-17-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/cienne\/dc007c14c8-1632851725\/cn-17-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/cienne\/dc007c14c8-1632851725\/cn-17-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/cienne\/dc007c14c8-1632851725\/cn-17-2048x.jpg 2048w","righttype":"image"},"id":"94ad8c97-54b1-4d41-98e0-61e39a2cb895","isHidden":false,"type":"folio"},{"content":{"image":["cn-18-lo.mp4"],"srcset":"","type":"video"},"id":"ec558860-4c0f-400d-868e-a5ae3f5a6c60","isHidden":false,"type":"landscape"},{"content":{"lefttoggle":"false","lefttext":"","leftfooter":[],"leftimage":["cn-19.jpg"],"leftsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/cienne\/79ff01ea2c-1632851725\/cn-19-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/cienne\/79ff01ea2c-1632851725\/cn-19-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/cienne\/79ff01ea2c-1632851725\/cn-19-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/cienne\/79ff01ea2c-1632851725\/cn-19-2048x.jpg 2048w","lefttype":"image","righttoggle":"true","righttext":"

THE BRAND BOOK<\/p>

Created as a limited edition in 2018, the Cienne brand book is an extension of the ready-to-wear brand's visual identity. Like the garments, the book is carefully put together from high quality materials that embody Cienne's attention to detail and elevated aesthetic: the cover is a silk-screened acetate sleeve over fabric swatches pulled from the brand's various collections, while the outer box matches the vibrant yellow and pink from the Fall\u2013Winter '18 collection. The French folded interior pages feature the brand's two latest collections, along with video stills and brand strings.title: Rent The Runway
strings.introduction:
AN EVERCHANGING LOGO

is the hero in an adaptive identity for fashion rental site Rent The Runway.
strings.description: An everchanging logo is the hero in an adaptive identity for fashion rental site Rent The Runway.
strings.features:
[{"content":{"lefttoggle":"false","lefttext":"","leftfooter":[],"leftimage":["rtr-01.jpg"],"leftsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/rent-the-runway\/18e443c686-1632851725\/rtr-01-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/rent-the-runway\/18e443c686-1632851725\/rtr-01-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/rent-the-runway\/18e443c686-1632851725\/rtr-01-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/rent-the-runway\/18e443c686-1632851725\/rtr-01-2048x.jpg 2048w","lefttype":"image","righttoggle":"false","righttext":"","rightfooter":[],"rightimage":["rtr-02.jpg"],"rightsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/rent-the-runway\/e874d22b43-1632851725\/rtr-02-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/rent-the-runway\/e874d22b43-1632851725\/rtr-02-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/rent-the-runway\/e874d22b43-1632851725\/rtr-02-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/rent-the-runway\/e874d22b43-1632851725\/rtr-02-2048x.jpg 2048w","righttype":"image"},"id":"8cd16d0d-314c-450d-a1d9-370b872819cf","isHidden":false,"type":"folio"},{"content":{"lefttoggle":"true","lefttext":"

A pioneer of the clothing rental movement, Rent The Runway is an online service that leases designer dresses and accessories for a fraction of their retail price. Reinforced by the implementation of Unlimited \u2014 a subscription model offering a steady stream of designer pieces at a set monthly fee \u2014 it offers the user a steady rotation of new items to wear through access to an unlimited closet. This constant change became the core of Rent The Runway\u2019s new look.<\/p>

The solution is a playful but sophisticated visual identity that relies on rotation: the logo represents an ever-changing closet, based on a grid that allows to create hundreds of different variations of the logo. A muted color palette positions the otherwise playful visual identity as an elevated experience, applied by Rent The Runway\u2019s in-house design team into a wide array of digital and printed implementations.<\/p>","leftfooter":[{"heading":"Rent The Runway","text":"2105"},{"heading":"SERVICES","text":"Visual Identity

CREDITS
Photography \/ Model: Rent The Runway
Logo Animation: strings.title: Maisonette
strings.introduction:
ELEVATING DOODLES FOR

Maisonette, an online destination for children.
strings.description: Elevating doodles for Maisonette, an online destination for children.
strings.categories: Visual Identity, Print Design, Web Design
strings.features:
[{"content":{"lefttoggle":"false","lefttext":"","leftfooter":[],"leftimage":["maisonette-01.jpg"],"leftsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/maisonette\/fa845514ea-1632861685\/maisonette-01-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/maisonette\/fa845514ea-1632861685\/maisonette-01-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/maisonette\/fa845514ea-1632861685\/maisonette-01-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/maisonette\/fa845514ea-1632861685\/maisonette-01-2048x.jpg 2048w","lefttype":"image","righttoggle":"false","righttext":"","rightfooter":[],"rightimage":["maisonette-02.jpg"],"rightsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/maisonette\/c927e6b688-1632861685\/maisonette-02-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/maisonette\/c927e6b688-1632861685\/maisonette-02-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/maisonette\/c927e6b688-1632861685\/maisonette-02-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/maisonette\/c927e6b688-1632861685\/maisonette-02-2048x.jpg 2048w","righttype":"image"},"id":"264ade21-e341-4502-8178-bc674225072b","isHidden":false,"type":"folio"},{"content":{"lefttoggle":"true","lefttext":"

Maisonette is a children\u2019s e-tailer, offering a curated selection of the best children\u2019s brands on the market. Founded by Vogue alumni Sylvana Durrett and Luisana Mendoza Roccia, the website stocks hundreds of brands \u2013 from cult, international and up-and-coming labels \u2014 in one convenient, stylish digital home.<\/p>

As a high-end destination for all things children, the visual identity explores the playful point of view of a child juxtaposed with grown-up sophistication. A colorful doodle pattern is the hero in a joyful visual identity elevated with gold foil and a vibrant blue applied throughout implementations. The logomark is a nod to the definition of maisonette \u2014 a little house \u2014 and its initial M, and can be paired with the logotype or detached to work on its own.<\/p>","leftfooter":[{"heading":"Maisonette","text":"2016"},{"heading":"SERVICES","text":"Visual Identity

The pattern is used across both printed and digital implementations, and can also be strings.title: Tray
strings.introduction:
A COLORFUL TRAY FOR

German furniture brand

is designed to work for a variety of uses.
strings.description: A colorful tray designed for German furniture brand works for a variety of uses.
strings.features:
[{"content":{"lefttoggle":"false","lefttext":"","leftfooter":[],"leftimage":["tray-01.jpg"],"leftsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/tray\/950c63060a-1632851725\/tray-01-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/tray\/950c63060a-1632851725\/tray-01-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/tray\/950c63060a-1632851725\/tray-01-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/tray\/950c63060a-1632851725\/tray-01-2048x.jpg 2048w","lefttype":"image","righttoggle":"false","righttext":"","rightfooter":[],"rightimage":["tray-02-lo.mp4"],"rightsrcset":"","righttype":"video"},"id":"b46d61f5-d605-4411-9e1a-9e47fb20b42e","isHidden":false,"type":"folio"},{"content":{"lefttoggle":"true","lefttext":"

Conceptualised and designed for German design brand Akttem, Tray is a storage system that functions as a serving tray but that can also be disassembled to work for a variety of uses. Inspired by an interest for color, tactility and composition, the colorful collection of shapes and sizes can be used as coasters or trivets, encouraging the use of the individual pieces for anything one could need a little surface for. To support the multi-use concept, sophisticated craftsmanship was combined with sustainable materials that are both heat and water resistant. strings.title: Bec Brittain
strings.introduction: A visual identity inspired by the innovative nature of Bec Brittain’s lighting.
strings.description: A visual identity inspired by the innovative nature of Bec Brittain’s lighting.
strings.categories: Visual Identity, Print Design, Web Design
strings.features:
[{"content":{"lefttoggle":"false","lefttext":"","leftfooter":[],"leftimage":["bb-01.jpg"],"leftsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/bec-brittain\/18d3897c5e-1632861685\/bb-01-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/bec-brittain\/18d3897c5e-1632861685\/bb-01-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/bec-brittain\/18d3897c5e-1632861685\/bb-01-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/bec-brittain\/18d3897c5e-1632861685\/bb-01-2048x.jpg 2048w","lefttype":"image","righttoggle":"false","righttext":"","rightfooter":[],"rightimage":["bb-02.jpg"],"rightsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/bec-brittain\/63aa6f7736-1632861685\/bb-02-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/bec-brittain\/63aa6f7736-1632861685\/bb-02-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/bec-brittain\/63aa6f7736-1632861685\/bb-02-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/bec-brittain\/63aa6f7736-1632861685\/bb-02-2048x.jpg 2048w","righttype":"image"},"id":"76a2c865-aff9-4ae8-98e3-3775715c49a7","isHidden":false,"type":"folio"},{"content":{"lefttoggle":"true","lefttext":"

Bec Brittain is an acclaimed New York-based lighting and product designer driven by luxurious materials, intuitive forms and forward-thinking technology. The studio explores and experiments with new techniques and materials, pushing the boundaries of American-made, centerpiece lighting design. The visual identity aims to capture the contemporary and elevated nature of Bec Brittain\u2019s lighting. Interpreting the seamless combination of the various materials and handicraft used to produce Brittain\u2019s pieces, the logo comprises of two different typefaces that come together to form the logotype. The printed materials feature dark surfaces finished with a copper foiled logo, that glows reminiscent of LED lights \u2014 a key component of Bec Brittain\u2019s modular lighting.<\/p>

The website is both immersive and informative, presenting alternate displays for the three different product categories: the main collection, special editions and custom made pieces. Visit website<\/a><\/p>","leftfooter":[{"heading":"Bec Brittain","text":"2014"},{"heading":"SERVICES","text":"Visual Identity

strings.title: Leader Bag Co
strings.introduction: A minimal identity livened with illustration for a brand of family backpacks with values.
strings.description: A minimal identity livened with illustrations for a brand of family backpacks with values.
strings.categories: Visual Identity, Web Design, Print Design
strings.features:
[{"content":{"lefttoggle":"false","lefttext":"","leftfooter":[],"leftimage":["leader-01.jpg"],"leftsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/leader-bag-co\/a469a68af4-1632855622\/leader-01-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/leader-bag-co\/a469a68af4-1632855622\/leader-01-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/leader-bag-co\/a469a68af4-1632855622\/leader-01-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/leader-bag-co\/a469a68af4-1632855622\/leader-01-2048x.jpg 2048w","lefttype":"image","righttoggle":"false","righttext":"","rightfooter":[],"rightimage":["leader-02.jpg"],"rightsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/leader-bag-co\/4cc299457b-1632855622\/leader-02-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/leader-bag-co\/4cc299457b-1632855622\/leader-02-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/leader-bag-co\/4cc299457b-1632855622\/leader-02-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/leader-bag-co\/4cc299457b-1632855622\/leader-02-2048x.jpg 2048w","righttype":"image"},"id":"8c0e0530-6181-4f27-bfe8-87aa6662f2b4","isHidden":false,"type":"folio"},{"content":{"lefttoggle":"true","lefttext":"

Leader Bag Co\u2019s family backpacks set a new standard for style, utility and quality of diaper bags. The product is contemporary and utilitarian, with a simple, gender-neutral design. This was reflected in a thoughtful, understated visual identity: a minimal logotype complemented by a safety pin icon, seemingly fastened to any surface it\u2019s applied upon to add dimension and depth to the visual identity.<\/p>","leftfooter":[{"heading":"Leader Bag Co","text":"2013"},{"heading":"SERVICES","text":"Visual Identity

THE ILLUSTRATIONS<\/p>

In 2018, the visual identity was expanded to embody the brand's new Lead With initiative and its five values: Love, Solidarity, Wisdom, Peace and Kindness. To bring them front and center, a library of illustrations was added to the identity. Friendly and colorful, they add both warm and whimsy to the brand. strings.title: Posture
strings.introduction: Typography with opposing features and bold use of color for biannual print publication Posture.
strings.description: Typography with opposing features and bold use of color for biannual print publication Posture.
strings.features:
[{"content":{"lefttoggle":"false","lefttext":"","leftfooter":[],"leftimage":["posture-01.jpg"],"leftsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/posture\/efa1e06cbf-1632518745\/posture-01-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/posture\/efa1e06cbf-1632518745\/posture-01-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/posture\/efa1e06cbf-1632518745\/posture-01-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/posture\/efa1e06cbf-1632518745\/posture-01-2048x.jpg 2048w","lefttype":"image","righttoggle":"false","righttext":"","rightfooter":[],"rightimage":["posture-02.jpg"],"rightsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/posture\/451bedf67a-1632518745\/posture-02-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/posture\/451bedf67a-1632518745\/posture-02-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/posture\/451bedf67a-1632518745\/posture-02-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/posture\/451bedf67a-1632518745\/posture-02-2048x.jpg 2048w","righttype":"image"},"id":"4e9e3d7c-f2a5-4f35-a3e5-28eb2099d794","isHidden":false,"type":"folio"},{"content":{"lefttoggle":"true","lefttext":"

Posture is a biannual print publication dedicated to identity: it gives a platform to marginalized voices and communities, exploring gender, sexuality, race and feminism through art and fashion. The starting point for Posture\u2019s rebrand was the publication\u2019s tagline: the creative exploration of identity. The task was to redesign Posture as a publication that wouldn\u2019t look stiff or restrained, but still come across as a cohesive experience: a bold and fun magazine with sophistication. The topics and photography across the magazine are all stories of individual identities, and therefore stylistically broad \u2013 how can each stand on their own, while clearly living within the same covers?<\/p>

The solution was a strong use of color, not limited to a set palette, allowing for interpreting each article with its own hue. The abundance of strong colors ties everything together. A narrowed type palette helped create a cohesive experience, relying on only two alternative title typefaces: Portrait Condensed \u2013 a skinny and tall serif \u2013 and Dia Black \u2013 a bold and wide sans serif. With their opposing features, the fonts act as another analogy for the expression of identity. The Boss Issue (03\/16) is the first to showcase the redesign of the magazine.<\/p>","leftfooter":[{"heading":"Posture","text":"2016"},{"heading":"SERVICES","text":"Editorial Design

CREDITS
Editor-In-Chief: Winter Mendelson
Publisher: Wayward Wild
Design Director: Ryan Essmaker
Cover Photography: Kate strings.title: Happy Bones
strings.introduction: A stencil logo for New York-based shop serving speciality coffees, local art and global publications.
strings.description: A stencil logo for New York-based shop serving speciality coffees, local art and global publications.
strings.features:
[{"content":{"lefttoggle":"false","lefttext":"","leftfooter":[],"leftimage":["happybones-01.jpg"],"leftsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/happy-bones\/f5c7370a85-1632518745\/happybones-01-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/happy-bones\/f5c7370a85-1632518745\/happybones-01-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/happy-bones\/f5c7370a85-1632518745\/happybones-01-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/happy-bones\/f5c7370a85-1632518745\/happybones-01-2048x.jpg 2048w","lefttype":"image","righttoggle":"false","righttext":"","rightfooter":[],"rightimage":["happybones-02.jpg"],"rightsrcset":"https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/happy-bones\/bfc07fc47f-1632518745\/happybones-02-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/happy-bones\/bfc07fc47f-1632518745\/happybones-02-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/happy-bones\/bfc07fc47f-1632518745\/happybones-02-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/lottanieminencom-6592.kxcdn.com\/media\/pages\/index\/happy-bones\/bfc07fc47f-1632518745\/happybones-02-2048x.jpg 2048w","righttype":"image"},"id":"357b5086-8b61-4f0f-98d6-6e5d1bc7564b","isHidden":false,"type":"folio"},{"content":{"lefttoggle":"true","lefttext":"

Happy Bones is New York-based coffee shop with a New Zealand heart, serving speciality coffees, local art and global publications at 394 Broome Street. Applied across a variety of products, the logo had to be recognizable: based on a modified stencil typeface, it is an abstracted interpretation of bones. The brand color palette is reduced to black and white, acting as a neutral canvas to the frequent art showcases and collaborations paired with the identity.<\/p>","leftfooter":[{"heading":"Happy Bones","text":"2013"},{"heading":"SERVICES","text":"Visual Identity

CREDITS
Bone pattern: Nanda strings.title: Bvlgari
strings.description: Illustrations for Italian jewelry and luxury goods brand Bvlgari’s Summer ’17 campaign. Channelling the theme of Roman Holiday, the illustrations highlight Rome’s landmarks, buildings, people and sun-splashed streets in a series of two maps. Produced in green and orange color ways, the map was also adapted into a darker version for the brand’s new perfume release, Goldea Roman Nights. For windows displays in Bvlgari stores worldwide, the maps were printed on canvas panels, finished with golden scooters and icons Fiat 500’s driving along the streets. In order to work on windows of all dimensions, the map can be duplicated on all sides to create a tiled pattern. The illustrations were also animated by Italian director Virgilio Villoresi, bringing the Roman Holiday campaign to life.

strings.title: Marja Kurki
strings.description: Silk scarf design for Marja Kurki, a Finnish manufacturer of high quality silk scarves and ties. The scarf, produced in two bright color variations, pictures a secret garden: wildly sprawling vegetation surrounded by a tall fence and guarded by the animals inhabiting it.

strings.title: Herman Miller
strings.description: Illustration for Herman Miller’s 2014 gifting guide. The American manufacturer of office and home furnishings wanted to create a festive scene to display select products suited for holiday gifting. The solution is an illustrated, colorful house, showcasing the homeware across different rooms. Built into a multilayered life-size set, the photograph can be used in separate slices or connected on either end.

strings.title: Liberty
strings.description: Pattern design for luxury department store Liberty’s Fall ’15 collection of art fabrics. Printed on the company’s unique Tana Lawn cotton, the pattern comes in 5 color ways, depicting British muslin cotton dresses from the 18th century. Set in a floral garden, the design is also an interpretation of some of the patterns found in dresses of that era.

strings.title: Cook In A Book
strings.description: The Cook In A Book series is a colorful collection of interactive recipe books published by Phaidon. Novelty features such as pull-tabs, wheels, and punch-out pieces invite young children to practice the cooking process on their own. In the series: Cook In A Book: Pancakes! / Cook In A Book: Pizza! / Cook In A Book: Tacos! / Cook In A Book: Cookies!
strings.features:
[{"content":{"image":["cook-cover-01.jpg"],"srcset":"https:\/\/www.lottanieminen.com\/media\/pages\/illustration\/cook-in-a-book\/262258ba67-1632151671\/cook-cover-01-352x.jpg 352w, https:\/\/www.lottanieminen.com\/media\/pages\/illustration\/cook-in-a-book\/262258ba67-1632151671\/cook-cover-01-864x.jpg 864w, https:\/\/www.lottanieminen.com\/media\/pages\/illustration\/cook-in-a-book\/262258ba67-1632151671\/cook-cover-01-1408x.jpg 1408w, https:\/\/www.lottanieminen.com\/media\/pages\/illustration\/cook-in-a-book\/262258ba67-1632151671\/cook-cover-01-2048x.jpg 2048w","type":"image"},"id":"aff230a3-fd4e-48e9-8f21-f0bf6153eb24","isHidden":false,"type":"landscape"},{"content":{"lefttoggle":"true","lefttext":"

The Cook In A Book series is a colorful collection of interactive recipe books published by Phaidon. Novelty features such as pull-tabs, wheels, and punch-out pieces invite young children to practice the cooking process on their own. So far in the series:<\/p>

<\/p>

Cook In A Book: Pancakes! Purchase<\/a><\/p>

Cook In A Book: Pizza! Purchase<\/a><\/p>

Cook In A Book: Tacos! Purchase<\/a><\/p>

Cook In A Book: Cookies! Purchase<\/a><\/p>

<\/p>

\u201dSome cooks only glance at a recipe to get the gist, while others follow instructions to a T. This stylish board book promotes the latter with its simple, graphic illustrations that resemble paintings by Frank Stella. Kids can pretend to cook using this very book instead of a toy, and there are no stains or spills or crumbs.\u201d \u2014 New York Times \/ strings.title: Marimekko
strings.description: Holiday campaign for Marimekko, the iconic home furnishings, textiles, and fashion company from Finland. Inspired by the cheerful and warm colours of Marimekko's winter collection of home goods and apparel, the illustration showcases a colourful city preparing for the holiday season. Applied to digital and printed advertisements, the Christmas City illustration was tightly cropped to create abstracted backgrounds with little characters playfully interacting with Marimekko products. The illustration was also built out as a stand for products to be displayed on, appearing in Marimekko windows globally during the holiday season.

strings.title: Finnish Post
strings.description: Stamp design for the Finnish Post. Released in September 2015, the stamp sheet includes 6 individual first class stamps. Each playfully depicts a small house inspired by Helsinki architecture, allowing people to put together a miniature town of their own when using the stamps on an envelope or package.

strings.title: Facebook Events
strings.description: A set of 12 event theme illustrations for Facebook. The feature allows the user to choose from a gallery of illustrated themes to use as their event cover photo. Centered around range of popular celebrations and gatherings that people host on Facebook, this set includes Graduation, Class Reunion, Memorial, Bachelor Party, Engagement Party, Bridal Shower, Bachelorette Party, Baby Shower, Birthday, Family Reunion, Anniversary and Farewell Party.

strings.title: Cityscapes
strings.description: Series of 8 limited edition silkscreen prints for first solo show Cityscapes, at Printa Gallery in Budapest, Hungary. The Budapest inspired prints — picturing the Széchenyi baths, the Nagy Vásárcsarnok market hall, the Keleti railway station and life around the Danube river — are added to a cityscape collection depicting Lisbon, Helsinki and New York. A limited quantity of posters is available for sale, inquiries over email. Tall — 35 × 100 cm / 14" × 39.5" 1. Large — 100 × 70 cm / 39.5" × 27.5".

strings.title: Google Calendar
strings.description: A set of monthly header illustrations for Google’s redesigned Calendar app. Functioning as the app’s monthly dividers, the themes picture landscapes across seasons. The atmosphere of each month is conveyed through colors selected from Google’s Material Design palette, while little characters sprinkled throughout tell small stories within the images, their activities slowly changing with each season passing. Download app

strings.title: Walk This World
strings.description: Illustrations for Walk This World, a children’s book debut published in the UK, US, Canada, Australia, France, Germany, Italy and Finland. Written by Jenny Broom, the book pictures a child on a daylong journey around the globe. Little flaps invite the reader to peek inside the cityscapes and all their cultural differences. Purchase

strings.title: Laneige
strings.description: Packaging illustrations for Laneige, a South Korean cosmetics brand owned by Amore Pacific. The limited edition packaging and related Waterful campaign aim to bring awareness to the company’s program constructing water tanks in African countries suffering from water shortage.

strings.title: Sokos
strings.description: Illustrated collection of housewares for Finnish department store chain Sokos. Created as a holiday capsule, the collection is called Ensilumi (First Snow), with illustrations depicting a city being gradually coated in snow. Steering away from the typical Christmas palette, First Snow is light blue — crisp and cold. The line included implementations such as plates, mugs, bed linens, decorative pillows, oven mitts, towels, cutting boards, gift boxes and pajamas.

strings.title: Hermès
strings.description: Window display illustrations for French high fashion house Hermès, showcased in seven of their stores on the U.S. East Coast. With the goal of conveying a fun and relaxed summer mood, the campaign consisted of two variations – a cityscape and a landscape overlooking an underwater world. The illustrations had to work in windows of different dimensions, so it was layered for flexibility and to better display products within the artwork.
